013package org.apache.juneau.json;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.StringUtils.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.internal.Utils.*;
017import java.io.*;
018import java.lang.reflect.*;
019import java.nio.charset.*;
020import java.util.*;
021import java.util.function.*;
022
023import org.apache.juneau.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.common.internal.*;
026import org.apache.juneau.httppart.*;
027import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
028import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
029import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
030
031/**
032 * Session object that lives for the duration of a single use of {@link JsonParser}.
033 *
034 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
035 *    <li class='warn'>This class is not thread safe and is typically discarded after one use.
036 * </ul>
037 *
038 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
039 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../index.html#jm.JsonDetails">JSON Details</a>
040
041 * </ul>
042 */
043@SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "rawtypes" })
044public final class JsonParserSession extends ReaderParserSession {
045
046   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
047   // Static
048   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
049
050   private static final AsciiSet decChars = AsciiSet.create().ranges("0-9").build();
051
052   /**
053    * Creates a new builder for this object.
054    *
055    * @param ctx The context creating this session.
056    * @return A new builder.
057    */
058   public static Builder create(JsonParser ctx) {
059      return new Builder(ctx);
060   }
061
062   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
063   // Builder
064   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
065
066   /**
067    * Builder class.
068    */
069   @FluentSetters
070   public static class Builder extends ReaderParserSession.Builder {
071
072      JsonParser ctx;
073
074      /**
075       * Constructor
076       *
077       * @param ctx The context creating this session.
078       */
079      protected Builder(JsonParser ctx) {
080         super(ctx);
081         this.ctx = ctx;
082      }
083
084      @Override
085      public JsonParserSession build() {
086         return new JsonParserSession(this);
087      }
088
089      // <FluentSetters>
090
091      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
092      public <T> Builder apply(Class<T> type, Consumer<T> apply) {
093         super.apply(type, apply);
094         return this;
095      }
096
097      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
098      public Builder debug(Boolean value) {
099         super.debug(value);
100         return this;
101      }
102
103      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
104      public Builder properties(Map<String,Object> value) {
105         super.properties(value);
106         return this;
107      }
108
109      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */
110      public Builder property(String key, Object value) {
111         super.property(key, value);
112         return this;
113      }
114
115      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.ContextSession.Builder */

117         super.unmodifiable();
118         return this;
119      }

123         super.locale(value);
124         return this;
125      }

129         super.localeDefault(value);
130         return this;
131      }

135         super.mediaType(value);
136         return this;
137      }

141         super.mediaTypeDefault(value);
142         return this;
143      }

147         super.timeZone(value);

153         super.timeZoneDefault(value);

155      }

159         super.javaMethod(value);
160         return this;
161      }

165         super.outer(value);
166         return this;
167      }

170      public Builder schema(HttpPartSchema value) {
171         super.schema(value);
172         return this;
173      }

176      public Builder schemaDefault(HttpPartSchema value) {

195
196   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
197   // Instance
198   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
199
200   private final JsonParser ctx;
201
202   /**
203    * Constructor.
204    *
205    * @param builder The builder for this object.
206    */
207   protected JsonParserSession(Builder builder) {
208      super(builder);
209      ctx = builder.ctx;
210   }
211
212   /**
213    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace.
214    *
215    * <p>
216    * The definition of whitespace is different for strict vs lax mode.
217    * Strict mode only interprets 0x20 (space), 0x09 (tab), 0x0A (line feed) and 0x0D (carriage return) as whitespace.
218    * Lax mode uses {@link Character#isWhitespace(int)} to make the determination.
219    *
220    * @param cp The codepoint.
221    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace.
222    */
223   protected boolean isWhitespace(int cp) {
224      if (isStrict())
225            return cp <= 0x20 && (cp == 0x09 || cp == 0x0A || cp == 0x0D || cp == 0x20);
226      return Character.isWhitespace(cp);
227   }
228
229   /**
230    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.
231    *
232    * @param cp The codepoint.
233    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified character is whitespace or '/'.
234    */
235   protected boolean isCommentOrWhitespace(int cp) {
236      if (cp == '/')
237         return true;
238      if (isStrict())
239         return cp <= 0x20 && (cp == 0x09 || cp == 0x0A || cp == 0x0D || cp == 0x20);
240      return Character.isWhitespace(cp);
241   }
242
243   @Override /* ParserSession */
244   protected <T> T doParse(ParserPipe pipe, ClassMeta<T> type) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
245      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
246         if (r == null)
247            return null;
248         T o = parseAnything(type, r, getOuter(), null);
249         validateEnd(r);
250         return o;
251      }
252   }
253
254   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
255   protected <K,V> Map<K,V> doParseIntoMap(ParserPipe pipe, Map<K,V> m, Type keyType, Type valueType) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
256      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
257         m = parseIntoMap2(r, m, (ClassMeta<K>)getClassMeta(keyType), (ClassMeta<V>)getClassMeta(valueType), null);
258         validateEnd(r);
259         return m;
260      }
261   }
262
263   @Override /* ReaderParserSession */
264   protected <E> Collection<E> doParseIntoCollection(ParserPipe pipe, Collection<E> c, Type elementType) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
265      try (ParserReader r = pipe.getParserReader()) {
266         c = parseIntoCollection2(r, c, getClassMeta(elementType), null);
267         validateEnd(r);
268         return c;
269      }
270   }
271
272   private <T> T parseAnything(ClassMeta<?> eType, ParserReader r, Object outer, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
273
274      if (eType == null)
275         eType = object();
276      ObjectSwap<T,Object> swap = (ObjectSwap<T,Object>)eType.getSwap(this);
277      BuilderSwap<T,Object> builder = (BuilderSwap<T,Object>)eType.getBuilderSwap(this);
278      ClassMeta<?> sType = null;
279      if (builder != null)
280         sType = builder.getBuilderClassMeta(this);
281      else if (swap != null)
282         sType = swap.getSwapClassMeta(this);
283      else
284         sType = eType;
285
286      if (sType.isOptional())
287         return (T)Utils.opt(parseAnything(eType.getElementType(), r, outer, pMeta));
288
289      setCurrentClass(sType);
290      String wrapperAttr = getJsonClassMeta(sType).getWrapperAttr();
291
292      Object o = null;
293
294      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
295      if (wrapperAttr != null)
296         skipWrapperAttrStart(r, wrapperAttr);
297      int c = r.peek();
298      if (c == -1) {
299         if (isStrict())
300            throw new ParseException(this, "Empty input.");
301         // Let o be null.
302      } else if ((c == ',' || c == '}' || c == ']')) {
303         if (isStrict())
304            throw new ParseException(this, "Missing value detected.");
305         // Handle bug in Cognos 10.2.1 that can product non-existent values.
306         // Let o be null;
307      } else if (c == 'n') {
308         parseKeyword("null", r);
309      } else if (sType.isObject()) {
310         if (c == '{') {
311            JsonMap m2 = new JsonMap(this);
312            parseIntoMap2(r, m2, string(), object(), pMeta);
313            o = cast(m2, pMeta, eType);
314         } else if (c == '[') {
315            o = parseIntoCollection2(r, new JsonList(this), object(), pMeta);
316         } else if (c == '\'' || c == '"') {
317            o = parseString(r);
318            if (sType.isChar())
319               o = parseCharacter(o);
320         } else if (c >= '0' && c <= '9' || c == '-' || c == '.') {
321            o = parseNumber(r, null);
322         } else if (c == 't') {
323            parseKeyword("true", r);
324            o = Boolean.TRUE;
325         } else {
326            parseKeyword("false", r);
327            o = Boolean.FALSE;
328         }
329      } else if (sType.isBoolean()) {
330         o = parseBoolean(r);
331      } else if (sType.isCharSequence()) {
332         o = parseString(r);
333      } else if (sType.isChar()) {
334         o = parseCharacter(parseString(r));
335      } else if (sType.isNumber()) {
336         o = parseNumber(r, (Class<? extends Number>)sType.getInnerClass());
337      } else if (sType.isMap()) {
338         Map m = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Map)sType.newInstance(outer) : newGenericMap(sType));
339         o = parseIntoMap2(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
340      } else if (sType.isCollection()) {
341         if (c == '{') {
342            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
343            parseIntoMap2(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
344            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
345         } else {
346            Collection l = (sType.canCreateNewInstance(outer) ? (Collection)sType.newInstance() : new JsonList(this));
347            o = parseIntoCollection2(r, l, sType, pMeta);
348         }
349      } else if (builder != null) {
350         BeanMap m = toBeanMap(builder.create(this, eType));
351         o = builder.build(this, parseIntoBeanMap2(r, m).getBean(), eType);
352      } else if (sType.canCreateNewBean(outer)) {
353         BeanMap m = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass());
354         o = parseIntoBeanMap2(r, m).getBean();
355      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer) && (c == '\'' || c == '"')) {
356         o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, parseString(r));
357      } else if (sType.isArray() || sType.isArgs()) {
358         if (c == '{') {
359            JsonMap m = new JsonMap(this);
360            parseIntoMap2(r, m, string(), object(), pMeta);
361            o = cast(m, pMeta, eType);
362         } else {
363            ArrayList l = (ArrayList)parseIntoCollection2(r, list(), sType, pMeta);
364            o = toArray(sType, l);
365         }
366      } else if (c == '{') {
367         Map m = new JsonMap(this);
368         parseIntoMap2(r, m, sType.getKeyType(), sType.getValueType(), pMeta);
369         if (m.containsKey(getBeanTypePropertyName(eType)))
370            o = cast((JsonMap)m, pMeta, eType);
371         else if (sType.getProxyInvocationHandler() != null)
372            o = newBeanMap(outer, sType.getInnerClass()).load(m).getBean();
373         else
374            throw new ParseException(this, "Class ''{0}'' could not be instantiated.  Reason: ''{1}''",
375                  sType.getInnerClass().getName(), sType.getNotABeanReason());
376      } else if (sType.canCreateNewInstanceFromString(outer) && ! isStrict()) {
377         o = sType.newInstanceFromString(outer, parseString(r));
378      } else {
379         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax for class type ''{0}'', starting character ''{1}''",
380            sType, (char)c);
381      }
382
383      if (wrapperAttr != null)
384         skipWrapperAttrEnd(r);
385
386      if (swap != null && o != null)
387         o = unswap(swap, o, eType);
388
389      if (outer != null)
390         setParent(eType, o, outer);
391
392      return (T)o;
393   }
394
395   private Number parseNumber(ParserReader r, Class<? extends Number> type) throws IOException, ParseException {
396      int c = r.peek();
397      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
398         return parseNumber(r, parseString(r), type);
399      return parseNumber(r, r.parseNumberString(), type);
400   }
401
402   private Number parseNumber(ParserReader r, String s, Class<? extends Number> type) throws ParseException {
403
404      // JSON has slightly different number rules from Java.
405      // Strict mode enforces these different rules, lax does not.
406      if (isStrict()) {
407
408         // Lax allows blank strings to represent 0.
409         // Strict does not allow blank strings.
410         if (s.isEmpty())
411            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
412
413         // Need to weed out octal and hexadecimal formats:  0123,-0123,0x123,-0x123.
414         // Don't weed out 0 or -0.
415         boolean isNegative = false;
416         char c = s.charAt(0);
417         if (c == '-') {
418            isNegative = true;
419            c = (s.length() == 1 ? 'x' : s.charAt(1));
420         }
421
422         // JSON doesn't allow '.123' and '-.123'.
423         if (c == '.')
424            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
425
426         // '01' is not a valid number, but '0.1', '0e1', '0e+1' are valid.
427         if (c == '0' && s.length() > (isNegative ? 2 : 1)) {
428            char c2 = s.charAt((isNegative ? 2 : 1));
429            if (c2 != '.' && c2 != 'e' && c2 != 'E')
430               throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
431         }
432
433         // JSON doesn't allow '1.' or '0.e1'.
434         int i = s.indexOf('.');
435         if (i != -1 && (s.length() == (i+1) || ! decChars.contains(s.charAt(i+1))))
436            throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid JSON number: ''{0}''", s);
437
438      }
439      return StringUtils.parseNumber(s, type);
440   }
441
442   private Boolean parseBoolean(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
443      int c = r.peek();
444      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
445         return Boolean.valueOf(parseString(r));
446      if (c == 't') {
447         parseKeyword("true", r);
448         return Boolean.TRUE;
449      } else if (c == 'f') {
450         parseKeyword("false", r);
451         return Boolean.FALSE;
452      } else {
453         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected boolean value, actual=''{0}''", r.read(100));
454      }
455   }
456
457   private <K,V> Map<K,V> parseIntoMap2(ParserReader r, Map<K,V> m, ClassMeta<K> keyType,
458         ClassMeta<V> valueType, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
459
460      if (keyType == null)
461         keyType = (ClassMeta<K>)string();
462
463      int S0=0; // Looking for outer {
464      int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
465      int S3=3; // Found attrName end, looking for :.
466      int S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
467      int S5=5; // Looking for , or }
468      int S6=6; // Found , looking for attr start.
469
470      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
471      int state = S0;
472      String currAttr = null;
473      int c = 0;
474      while (c != -1) {
475         c = r.read();
476         if (state == S0) {
477            if (c == '{')
478               state = S1;
479            else
480               break;
481         } else if (state == S1) {
482            if (c == '}') {
483               return m;
484            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
485               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
486            } else {
487               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
488               state = S3;
489            }
490         } else if (state == S3) {
491            if (c == ':')
492               state = S4;
493         } else if (state == S4) {
494            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
495               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
496            } else {
497               K key = convertAttrToType(m, currAttr, keyType);
498               V value = parseAnything(valueType, r.unread(), m, pMeta);
499               setName(valueType, value, key);
500               m.put(key, value);
501               state = S5;
502            }
503         } else if (state == S5) {
504            if (c == ',') {
505               state = S6;
506            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
507               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
508            } else if (c == '}') {
509               return m;
510            } else {
511               break;
512            }
513         } else if (state == S6) {
514            if (c == '}') {
515               break;
516            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
517               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
518            } else {
519               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
520               state = S3;
521            }
522         }
523      }
524      if (state == S0)
525         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
526      if (state == S1)
527         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
528      if (state == S3)
529         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
530      if (state == S4)
531         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
532      if (state == S5)
533         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' marking end of JSON object.");
534      if (state == S6)
535         throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected '}' found in JSON object.");
536
537      return null; // Unreachable.
538   }
539
540   /*
541    * Parse a JSON attribute from the character array at the specified position, then
542    * set the position marker to the last character in the field name.
543    */
544   private String parseFieldName(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
545      int c = r.peek();
546      if (c == '\'' || c == '"')
547         return parseString(r);
548      if (isStrict())
549         throw new ParseException(this, "Unquoted attribute detected.");
550      if (! VALID_BARE_CHARS.contains(c))
551         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find the start of the field name.");
552      r.mark();
553      // Look for whitespace.
554      while (c != -1) {
555         c = r.read();
556         if (! VALID_BARE_CHARS.contains(c)) {
557            r.unread();
558            String s = r.getMarked().intern();
559            return s.equals("null") ? null : s;
560         }
561      }
562      throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find the end of the field name.");
563   }
564
565   private static final AsciiSet VALID_BARE_CHARS = AsciiSet.create().range('A','Z').range('a','z').range('0','9').chars("$_-.").build();
566
567   private <E> Collection<E> parseIntoCollection2(ParserReader r, Collection<E> l,
568         ClassMeta<?> type, BeanPropertyMeta pMeta) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
569
570      final int
571         S0=0, // Looking for outermost [
572         S1=1, // Looking for starting [ or { or " or ' or LITERAL or ]
573         S2=2, // Looking for , or ]
574         S3=3; // Looking for starting [ or { or " or ' or LITERAL
575
576      int argIndex = 0;
577
578      int state = S0;
579      int c = 0;
580      while (c != -1) {
581         c = r.read();
582         if (state == S0) {
583            if (c == '[')
584               state = S1;
585            else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c))
586               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
587            else
588               break;  // Invalid character found.
589         } else if (state == S1) {
590            if (c == ']') {
591               return l;
592            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
593               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
594            } else if (c != -1) {
595               l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(), r.unread(), l, pMeta));
596               state = S2;
597            }
598         } else if (state == S2) {
599            if (c == ',') {
600               state = S3;
601            } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
602               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
603            } else if (c == ']') {
604               return l;
605            } else {
606               break;  // Invalid character found.
607            }
608         } else if (state == S3) {
609            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
610               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
611            } else if (c == ']') {
612               break;
613            } else if (c != -1) {
614               l.add((E)parseAnything(type.isArgs() ? type.getArg(argIndex++) : type.getElementType(), r.unread(), l, pMeta));
615               state = S2;
616            }
617         }
618      }
619      if (state == S0)
620         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '[' at beginning of JSON array.");
621      if (state == S1)
622         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
623      if (state == S2)
624         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected ',' or ']'.");
625      if (state == S3)
626         throw new ParseException(this, "Unexpected trailing comma in array.");
627
628      return null;  // Unreachable.
629   }
630
631   private <T> BeanMap<T> parseIntoBeanMap2(ParserReader r, BeanMap<T> m) throws IOException, ParseException, ExecutableException {
632
633      int S0=0; // Looking for outer {
634      int S1=1; // Looking for attrName start.
635      int S3=3; // Found attrName end, looking for :.
636      int S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
637      int S5=5; // Looking for , or }
638
639      int state = S0;
640      String currAttr = "";
641      int c = 0;
642      mark();
643      try {
644         while (c != -1) {
645            c = r.read();
646            if (state == S0) {
647               if (c == '{') {
648                  state = S1;
649               } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
650                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
651               } else {
652                  break;
653               }
654            } else if (state == S1) {
655               if (c == '}') {
656                  return m;
657               } else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
658                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
659               } else {
660                  r.unread();
661                  mark();
662                  currAttr = parseFieldName(r);
663                  state = S3;
664               }
665            } else if (state == S3) {
666               if (c == ':')
667                  state = S4;
668            } else if (state == S4) {
669               if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
670                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
671               } else {
672                  if (! currAttr.equals(getBeanTypePropertyName(m.getClassMeta()))) {
673                     BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(currAttr);
674                     setCurrentProperty(pMeta);
675                     if (pMeta == null) {
676                        onUnknownProperty(currAttr, m, parseAnything(object(), r.unread(), m.getBean(false), null));
677                        unmark();
678                     } else {
679                        unmark();
680                        ClassMeta<?> cm = pMeta.getClassMeta();
681                        Object value = parseAnything(cm, r.unread(), m.getBean(false), pMeta);
682                        setName(cm, value, currAttr);
683                        try {
684                           pMeta.set(m, currAttr, value);
685                        } catch (BeanRuntimeException e) {
686                           onBeanSetterException(pMeta, e);
687                           throw e;
688                        }
689                     }
690                     setCurrentProperty(null);
691                  }
692                  state = S5;
693               }
694            } else if (state == S5) {
695               if (c == ',')
696                  state = S1;
697               else if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c))
698                  skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
699               else if (c == '}') {
700                  return m;
701               }
702            }
703         }
704         if (state == S0)
705            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
706         if (state == S1)
707            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
708         if (state == S3)
709            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
710         if (state == S4)
711            throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
712         if (state == S5)
713            throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' marking end of JSON object.");
714      } finally {
715         unmark();
716      }
717
718      return null; // Unreachable.
719   }
720
721   /*
722    * Starting from the specified position in the character array, returns the
723    * position of the character " or '.
724    * If the string consists of a concatenation of strings (e.g. 'AAA' + "BBB"), this method
725    * will automatically concatenate the strings and return the result.
726    */
727   private String parseString(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
728      r.mark();
729      int qc = r.read();      // The quote character being used (" or ')
730      if (qc != '"' && isStrict()) {
731         String msg = (
732            qc == '\''
733            ? "Invalid quote character \"{0}\" being used."
734            : "Did not find quote character marking beginning of string.  Character=\"{0}\""
735         );
736         throw new ParseException(this, msg, (char)qc);
737      }
738      final boolean isQuoted = (qc == '\'' || qc == '"');
739      String s = null;
740      boolean isInEscape = false;
741      int c = 0;
742      while (c != -1) {
743         c = r.read();
744         // Strict syntax requires that all control characters be escaped.
745         if (isStrict() && c <= 0x1F)
746            throw new ParseException(this, "Unescaped control character encountered: ''0x{0}''", String.format("%04X", c));
747         if (isInEscape) {
748            switch (c) {
749               case 'n': r.replace('\n'); break;
750               case 'r': r.replace('\r'); break;
751               case 't': r.replace('\t'); break;
752               case 'f': r.replace('\f'); break;
753               case 'b': r.replace('\b'); break;
754               case '\\': r.replace('\\'); break;
755               case '/': r.replace('/'); break;
756               case '\'': r.replace('\''); break;
757               case '"': r.replace('"'); break;
758               case 'u': {
759                  String n = r.read(4);
760                  try {
761                     r.replace(Integer.parseInt(n, 16), 6);
762                  } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
763                     throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid Unicode escape sequence in string.");
764                  }
765                  break;
766               }
767               default:
768                  throw new ParseException(this, "Invalid escape sequence in string.");
769            }
770            isInEscape = false;
771         } else {
772            if (c == '\\') {
773               isInEscape = true;
774               r.delete();
775            } else if (isQuoted) {
776               if (c == qc) {
777                  s = r.getMarked(1, -1);
778                  break;
779               }
780            } else {
781               if (c == ',' || c == '}' || c == ']' || isWhitespace(c)) {
782                  s = r.getMarked(0, -1);
783                  r.unread();
784                  break;
785               } else if (c == -1) {
786                  s = r.getMarked(0, 0);
787                  break;
788               }
789            }
790         }
791      }
792      if (s == null)
793         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find expected end character ''{0}''.", (char)qc);
794
795      // Look for concatenated string (i.e. whitespace followed by +).
796      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
797      if (r.peek() == '+') {
798         if (isStrict())
799            throw new ParseException(this, "String concatenation detected.");
800         r.read();  // Skip past '+', NOSONAR - Intentional.
801         skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
802         s += parseString(r);
803      }
804      return trim(s); // End of input reached.
805   }
806
807   /*
808    * Looks for the keywords true, false, or null.
809    * Throws an exception if any of these keywords are not found at the specified position.
810    */
811   private void parseKeyword(String keyword, ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
812      try {
813         String s = r.read(keyword.length());
814         if (s.equals(keyword))
815            return;
816         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected=''{0}'', Actual=''{1}''", keyword, s);
817      } catch (IndexOutOfBoundsException e) {
818         throw new ParseException(this, "Unrecognized syntax.  Expected=''{0}'', found end-of-file.", keyword);
819      }
820   }
821
822   /*
823    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond any whitespace or comments.
824    * If positionOnNext is 'true', then the cursor will be set to the point immediately after
825    * the comments and whitespace.  Otherwise, the cursor will be set to the last position of
826    * the comments and whitespace.
827    */
828   private void skipCommentsAndSpace(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
829      int c = 0;
830      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
831         if (! isWhitespace(c)) {
832            if (c == '/') {
833               if (isStrict())
834                  throw new ParseException(this, "Javascript comment detected.");
835               skipComments(r);
836            } else {
837               r.unread();
838               return;
839            }
840         }
841      }
842   }
843
844   /*
845    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond the construct "{wrapperAttr:" when
846    * the @Json(wrapperAttr) annotation is used on a class.
847    */
848   private void skipWrapperAttrStart(ParserReader r, String wrapperAttr) throws IOException, ParseException {
849
850      final int
851         S0=0, // Looking for outer '{'
852         S1=1, // Looking for attrName start.
853         S3=3, // Found attrName end, looking for :.
854         S4=4; // Found :, looking for valStart: { [ " ' LITERAL.
855
856      int state = S0;
857      String currAttr = null;
858      int c = 0;
859      while (c != -1) {
860         c = r.read();
861         if (state == S0) {
862            if (c == '{')
863               state = S1;
864         } else if (state == S1) {
865            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
866               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
867            } else {
868               currAttr = parseFieldName(r.unread());
869               if (! currAttr.equals(wrapperAttr))
870                  throw new ParseException(this,
871                     "Expected to find wrapper attribute ''{0}'' but found attribute ''{1}''", wrapperAttr, currAttr);
872               state = S3;
873            }
874         } else if (state == S3) {
875            if (c == ':')
876               state = S4;
877         } else if (state == S4) {
878            if (isCommentOrWhitespace(c)) {
879               skipCommentsAndSpace(r.unread());
880            } else {
881               r.unread();
882               return;
883            }
884         }
885      }
886      if (state == S0)
887         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected '{' at beginning of JSON object.");
888      if (state == S1)
889         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find attribute name on JSON object.");
890      if (state == S3)
891         throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find ':' following attribute name on JSON object.");
892      if (state == S4)
893         throw new ParseException(this, "Expected one of the following characters: {,[,',\",LITERAL.");
894   }
895
896   /*
897    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but moves the position beyond the construct "}" when
898    * the @Json(wrapperAttr) annotation is used on a class.
899    */
900   private void skipWrapperAttrEnd(ParserReader r) throws ParseException, IOException {
901      int c = 0;
902      while ((c = r.read()) != -1) {
903         if (! isWhitespace(c)) {
904            if (c == '/') {
905               if (isStrict())
906                  throw new ParseException(this, "Javascript comment detected.");
907               skipComments(r);
908            } else if (c == '}') {
909               return;
910            } else {
911               throw new ParseException(this, "Could not find '}' at the end of JSON wrapper object.");
912            }
913         }
914      }
915   }
916
917   /*
918    * Doesn't actually parse anything, but when positioned at the beginning of comment,
919    * it will move the pointer to the last character in the comment.
920    */
921   private void skipComments(ParserReader r) throws ParseException, IOException {
922      int c = r.read();
923      //  "/* */" style comments
924      if (c == '*') {
925         while (c != -1)
926            if ((c = r.read()) == '*')
927               if ((c = r.read()) == '/')
928                  return;
929      //  "//" style comments
930      } else if (c == '/') {
931         while (c != -1) {
932            c = r.read();
933            if (c == -1 || c == '\n')
934               return;
935         }
936      }
937      throw new ParseException(this, "Open ended comment.");
938   }
939
940   /*
941    * Call this method after you've finished a parsing a string to make sure that if there's any
942    * remainder in the input, that it consists only of whitespace and comments.
943    */
944   private void validateEnd(ParserReader r) throws IOException, ParseException {
945      if (! isValidateEnd())
946         return;
947      skipCommentsAndSpace(r);
948      int c = r.read();
949      if (c != -1 && c != ';')  // var x = {...}; expressions can end with a semicolon.
950         throw new ParseException(this, "Remainder after parse: ''{0}''.", (char)c);
951   }
952
953   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
954   // Properties
955   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
956
957   /**
958    * Validate end.
959    *
960    * @see JsonParser.Builder#validateEnd()
961    * @return
962    *    <jk>true</jk> if after parsing a POJO from the input, verifies that the remaining input in
963    *    the stream consists of only comments or whitespace.
964    */
965   protected boolean isValidateEnd() {
966      return ctx.isValidateEnd();
967   }
968
969   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
970   // Extended metadata
971   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
972
973   /**
974    * Returns the language-specific metadata on the specified class.
975    *
976    * @param cm The class to return the metadata on.
977    * @return The metadata.
978    */
979   protected JsonClassMeta getJsonClassMeta(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
980      return ctx.getJsonClassMeta(cm);
981   }
982}
